key_channel_insights.line_content: Parity slipped to 63 % while OTA mark-ups climbed to 18 %, signalling widening off-site price gaps.
Metasearch is cheaper on 73 % of itineraries (-5 % avg.), pressuring direct sales despite small week-on-week improvement.
GDS prices are higher on 93 % of fares, yet the premium is only 0.66 %, indicating a systemic but low-magnitude misalignment.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Only 63 % of OTA fares match the website, down 10 ppts month-on-month.
18 % of OTA itineraries carry a 7 % premium, the fastest-growing discrepancy.
Parity just 45 % on long-haul; nearly half of itineraries priced above direct.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Share down 2 ppts WoW and 10 ppts MoM, driven by short-haul weakness.
Mark-ups up 2.6 ppts WoW; average premium steady at 7 %.
Discount cases up 1.5 ppts WoW with a 4 % undercut.
Availability gaps improved slightly but still impact one in eight searches.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 65 % (-11 ppts MoM); 14 % OTA-higher at 9 % premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity falls to 48 %; OTA-higher spikes to 26 % and gaps hit 19 %.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 59 %; 17 % OTA-higher and 16 % not found hamper late revenue.
Parity 69 % but falling; 19 % OTA-higher with 7 % premium.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE cheaper on 72.8 % of fares, averaging a 5 % discount.
Same-price share rose 3.9 ppts WoW to 22.8 %.
85 % of Singapore departures are undercut, the networkâ€™s largest leakage.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Undercuts fell 2.3 ppts WoW but remain dominant.
Up 4 ppts MoM, indicating slow alignment.
Visibility gaps dropped 1.6 ppts WoW, yet still dilute reach.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 69 % undercut (-4 %); parity up 5.1 ppts WoW, no MSE premiums.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Undercut share drops to 61 %; parity gains 7 ppts WoW.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 70 % undercut with a 6 % gap; parity up 4.4 ppts WoW.
79 % undercut at 4 % gap; undercut share down 3.8 ppts WoW.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS higher than web on 92.8 % of fares; share creeping up.
Average gap just 0.66 %, pointing to systematic filing rather than strategy.
7 % of web fares absent in GDS, above the 5 % tolerance.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Dominant issue; premium edges up week-on-week.
Down 1 ppt WoW but still limits agency sales.
0 % of observations show identical pricing, underscoring misalignment.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 96 % higher but smaller 0.45 % premium; gaps fall to 4 %.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 93 % higher pricing; 0.52 % premium; no GDS undercuts.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 89 % higher; 0.58 % premium; missing offers peak at 10 %.
100 % higher with 0.81 % premium; all fares present.
